abstract: Five-time Wimbledon champion Venus Williams, who achieved equal pay for women at event in 2007, suggests Wimbledon's court assignments still give priority to top male players on principal courts; heavy rain complicates 2016 tournament's placements, which have put Williams and several other top female players' matches on outlying courts.

headline.print_headline: A Five-Time Champion Calls for Total Equality From Court to Court
headline.main: Venus Williams Makes a Call for Equality on the Wimbledon Courts

snippet: The five-time Wimbledon champion played a match on Court No. 18 on Thursday. Neither Roger Federer nor Rafael Nadal have played outside the main courts since 2004....
lead_paragraph: The five-time Wimbledon champion played a match on Court No. 18 on Thursday. Neither Roger Federer nor Rafael Nadal have played outside the main courts since 2004.
